Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.World
game.core.GameWorld
public class GameWorld extends city.cs.engine.World
Represents the game world, including the player, levels, and game mechanics.

This class extends World from the city.cs.engine package, providing physics simulation and entity management. It manages the player, collectibles, enemies, obstacles, and transitions between levels or game states.

The GameWorld is responsible for:

  • Creating and managing the physical environment (ground, platforms)
  • Loading level-specific configurations
  • Tracking player score and health
  • Handling level completion and game over conditions
  • Managing game state transitions (pausing, resuming)

  • Field Details

    • player

      private final city.cs.engine.DynamicBody player
      The player character. This is a DynamicBody that the user can control.

    • level

      private final int level
      The current level number. Used to determine which level configuration to load.

    • score

      private int score
      The player's current score. This increments when a collectible is gathered.

    • health

      private int health
      The player's remaining health. Reduced upon collisions with enemies or obstacles.

    • view

      private GameView view
      A reference to the current GameView for rendering this game world.

    • game

      private final Game game
      A reference to the main Game instance. Used for callbacks such as Game.gameCompleted().

    • isGameOverDisplayed

      private boolean isGameOverDisplayed
      A boolean value used to determine if the GameOverScreen is currently in frame. Used in the showGameOverScreen() method to prevent multiple game over screens.

    • loadedFromSave

      private boolean loadedFromSave
      A boolean value used to determine if the game currently in frame is one from the save files

  • Constructor Details

    • GameWorld

      public GameWorld(int level, Game game)
      Initializes the game world by creating ground, level-specific objects, and the player.

      Based on the level parameter, this constructor loads one of several level configurations. It also initializes a collision handler and default score/health values.

      The constructor performs the following setup:

      1. Creates the ground platform
      2. Loads the appropriate level configuration based on the level number
      3. Creates the player character
      4. Sets up collision detection
      5. Initializes score and health values

      Parameters:
      level - The level number to load (1-based).
      game - A reference to the main Game object that manages overall game flow.

  • Method Details

    • incrementScore

      public void incrementScore()
      Increments the score when a collectible is collected.

      Usually called from CollisionHandler when the player collides with a Collectible.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns the player's current score.
      Returns:
      the current score as an integer.

    • reduceHealth

      public void reduceHealth()
      Reduces the player's health by one. If health reaches zero or below, the Game Over screen is displayed.

      Typically invoked when the player collides with an enemy (not stomped) or an obstacle.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the player's current health.
      Returns:
      the current health as an integer.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Returns the current level number.
      Returns:
      the current level (1-based index).

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the player's health.
      Parameters:
      health - New health value.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Sets the player's score.
      Parameters:
      score - New score value.

    • showGameOverScreen

      public void showGameOverScreen()
      Displays the Game Over screen by removing all content from the frame and adding a GameOverScreen.

      This method:

      1. Checks if a Game Over screen is already displayed to prevent duplicates
      2. Plays the game over sound effect
      3. Stops background music
      4. Replaces the current view with the Game Over screen

    • showLevelCompleteScreen

      public void showLevelCompleteScreen()
      Displays the Level Complete screen. If the current level is below 4, shows LevelCompleteScreen, otherwise calls Game.gameCompleted().

      This method:

      1. Stops background music
      2. Resets game over sound to prevent unwanted playback
      3. For levels 1-3: Shows the Level Complete screen
      4. For level 4 (final level): Triggers the game completion sequence

    • checkLevelCompletion

      public void checkLevelCompletion()
      Checks if all collectibles in the level have been collected. If yes, shows the Level Complete screen. Otherwise, prompts the player to collect all coins first.

      This method compares the current score against the total number of collectibles in the level to determine if all have been collected.

    • getInitialCollectibleCount

      private int getInitialCollectibleCount()
      Determines the number of collectibles at the start of the level by counting all Collectible objects in the world.
      Returns:
      the total number of collectible items in the current level.

    • checkPlayerOutOfBounds

      public void checkPlayerOutOfBounds()
      Checks if the player has fallen off the screen (below y = -15). If so, triggers the Game Over screen.

      This method is typically called on each frame update to detect if the player has fallen into a pit or off the level boundaries.

    • pauseWorld

      public void pauseWorld()
      Pauses the world by stopping the physics simulation and freezing enemies/obstacles.

      This method is called when the game is paused, preventing further movement in the world. It performs the following actions:

      1. Stops the physics simulation engine
      2. Halts all enemy movement
      3. Stops all obstacle movement

    • resumeWorld

      public void resumeWorld()
      Resumes the world by restarting the physics simulation and resuming enemies/obstacles movement.

      This method is called when the game is unpaused, allowing movement to continue. It performs the following actions:

      1. Restarts the physics simulation engine
      2. Resumes all enemy movement
      3. Resumes all obstacle movement

    • setView

      public void setView(GameView view)
      Sets the GameView associated with this world.

      The GameView is responsible for rendering the world and its entities.

      Parameters:
      view - the GameView to be associated with this GameWorld.

    • getView

      public GameView getView()
      Returns the GameView associated with this world.
      Returns:
      the currently assigned GameView.

    • getPlayer

      public city.cs.engine.DynamicBody getPlayer()
      Returns the player character.

      This method provides access to the player entity, which can be used to modify player properties, position, or behavior.

      Returns:
      the DynamicBody representing the player.

    • loadEntities

      public void loadEntities(List<org.jbox2d.common.Vec2> enemyPositions, List<org.jbox2d.common.Vec2> collectiblePositions)
      Reloads all dynamic entities in the world from the provided saved positions.

      This method first destroys any existing Enemy or Collectible bodies in the world to prevent duplication. It then recreates Enemy instances at each coordinate in enemyPositions, and Collectible instances at each coordinate in collectiblePositions.

      Parameters:
      enemyPositions - a List<Vec2> of world coordinates at which to spawn new Enemy instances
      collectiblePositions - a List<Vec2> of world coordinates at which to spawn new Collectible instances

    • isLoadedFromSave

      public boolean isLoadedFromSave()
      Indicates whether this world was populated from a saved game state.
      Returns:
      true if the world was loaded from a save file; false otherwise

    • setLoadedFromSave

      public void setLoadedFromSave(boolean loadedFromSave)
      Marks this world as having been loaded from a saved game state.

      This flag can be used to conditionally skip certain initialization logic or tutorials when restoring from a save file.

      Parameters:
      loadedFromSave - true to indicate the world is restored from save; false to indicate a fresh start

    • clearEnemiesAndCollectibles

      public void clearEnemiesAndCollectibles()
      Clears all enemies and collectibles from the game world.

      This method iterates through all dynamic bodies in the game world and destroys any entities that are instances of Enemy or Collectible. It is typically used when loading a saved game state to ensure that only the entities from the save file are present in the world.
